",["$","em",null,{"children":"Shor's algorithm for integer factorization"}],".\nShor didn't describe his algorithm specifically in terms of phase estimation, but it is a natural and intuitive way to explain how it works."],"className":"group paragraph-el text-text-primary mx-0"}],"\n",["$","p",null,{"children":["We'll begin by discussing an intermediate problem known as the ",["$","em",null,{"children":"order-finding problem"}]," and see how phase estimation provides a solution to this problem.\nWe'll then see how an efficient solution to the order-finding problem gives us an efficient solution to the integer factorization problem.\n(When a solution to one problem provides a solution to another problem like this, we say that the second problem ",["$","em",null,{"children":"reduces"}]," to the first — so in this case we're reducing integer factorization to order finding.)\nThis second part of Shor's algorithm doesn't make use of quantum
